Brain stem death testing

Brain stem death testing . Diagnosis of death requires absent cranial nerve activity and no ventilatory response to hypercapnia.

Prerequisites for testing (2008 Academy of Medical Royal Colleges Guidelines):

  1. Apnoeic coma

  2. Irremediable structural brain injury

  3. Absence of another cause of coma:

a. Primary hypothermia (T < 34°C)

b. Primary metabolic/endocrine derangement:

Glucose <3 or >20 mmol/l

Na+ <115 or >160 mmol/l

Profound ↓ K+ / Mg+ / PO4-

c. MAP < 60mmHg

d. PaO2 < 10kPa; PaCO2 >6; abnormal pH

e. Drug intoxication/neuromuscular blockade. Thiopentone > 5mg/l

Midazolam > 10μg/l

f. Neuromuscular disorders

g. Abnormal posturing (decerebrate/ decorticate).
